featured.text: Which of the following is true about sea snakes? (A) Their salt glands can remove the salt in the seawater.
An eye stye is a small bump, resembling a pimple, that develops when an oil gland at the edge of an eyelid becomes infected by bacteria.
However, the sea snake’s salt glands cannot handle the massive amounts of salt that would enter their bodies if they actually drank seawater.

definition.zh_def: 腺體，指分泌物質的組織或器官。
definition.en_def: A gland is an organ in the body that secretes particular chemical substances for use in the body or for discharge into the surroundings.
definition.example: The thyroid gland produces hormones that regulate metabolism.
